title: I cannot drag my connections to other connection panels
author: sandersaares
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
I grab the tab header of a connection and drag-and-drop it to another connection panel to give it a new home.

## Current Behavior
I grab the tab header of a connection and drag-and-drop it but all it does is reorder the list of tabs. As far as I can tell it is impossible to actually move any connections to the new connection panel I created.

iterations.description: This is a valid, repeatedly requested missing capability (move an already-open connection to another panel) and is already tagged as needing implementation.
Current implementation only allows dragging ConnectionTabs between panels, not dragging ConnectionInfo nodes from the tree to a panel to open them.

comments.author: sadegr
comments.snippet:
I don't believe moving connections to a different connection panel is possible after connecting; however, it is possible to choose the connection panel prior to connecting.

First, create one or more connection panels from the View menu > Add Connection Panel. These can be dragged around and docked.

notes:
AI triage (codex): This is a valid, repeatedly requested missing capability (move an already-open connection to another panel) and is already tagged as needing implementation.
Approach: Add drag/drop and context-menu actions to move an active connection tab between existing connection panels while preserving focus and panel assignment.
AI triage (gemini): Current implementation only allows dragging ConnectionTabs between panels, not dragging ConnectionInfo nodes from the tree to a panel to open them.
Approach: Modify ConnectionWindow.cs drag-and-drop handlers to accept ConnectionInfo objects (from the tree view). When a ConnectionInfo is dropped, initiate the connection in that specific panel.
